description: The Pirate Party has long played an important role in fighting the worst excesses of copyright in the EU. For example, when a major copyright update was being discussed, the Pirate Party MEP Felix Reda wrote an insightful and practical report on what needed changing. Most of his recommendations were ignored in the final EU Copyright […]
title: There Is No Good Reason To Just Let Unsupported Video Games Die

description: If you’re a fan of chaos, well, the TikTok ban situation is providing plenty of chaos to follow. title: Another Billionaire Pushes A Bid For TikTok, But To Decentralize It

description: Bit of a weird one here. So, there’s the assumption made by all cops and most courts that any area visible to passersby does not have an expectation of privacy. That means front yards, open garages, etc. Courts and cops have mostly agreed this expectation of privacy does not suddenly appear no matter how long […]
title: Michigan Supreme Court Says Fourth Amendment Doesn’t Apply To Government Drone Use In Civil Cases

description: What do you get when you cross a Kennedy, a brain worm, and a social media giant? Apparently, another ridiculous lawsuit destined to be laughed out of court. title: Brain-Wormed RFK Jr. Sues Meta, Cites AI Chatbot Reply As Proof Of Shadowbanning

description: Before T-Mobile acquired Sprint, activists, consumer groups, and deal critics (including me) warned repeatedly that the telecom sector megadeal would result in layoffs, less competition, higher prices, and a lower quality product overall. The Trump FCC and DOJ very clearly didn’t care; they rubber stamped the deal without even reading deal impact reports. T-Mobile CEO […]
title: Report: Sprint, T-Mobile Merger Immediately Killed Wireless Price Competition In U.S.

description: For years and years we have documented here the trend of cord-cutting from traditional cable television services. But if cord-cutting was a thing the cable industry […]
title: Stream Subscription Hopping Is Here; Can Live Sports Tamp It Down?
